page.title: 19How we live.
page.content: It is difficult for visitors to tell the difference between the triangle of villages that makes up the district even allowing for the name signs. Inside the houses and bungalows however,they would find things very similar.Practically every house has a colour television set,and many have video recorders.Homes are comfortably furnished and while some still have open fires burning coal or wood, many more are now centrally heated, mostly by oil or electricity,as gas has not yet been piped near many homes. Cooking is mainly done by electricity, microwave ovens are becoming the latest thing people want as they cook things much more quickly.There are not many homes without labour saving devices such as washing machines and deep freezers.Gas is now coming into the area if people want it.
